prompt:
Answer this question.

		Question: who was saint paul the apostle
		Answer:
answer: Saint Paul the Apostle was an apostle who spread the Gospel. He was born in Tarsus and was originally named Saul. He was a Roman citizen and a Pharisee. He was converted to Christianity after having a vision of Jesus. He changed his name to Paul and became a missionary. He wrote letters and founded churches. He was martyred in Rome under Nero. He is considered one of the most important figures in Christianity.
